titles.title: Providing for consideration of a concurrent resolution providing for adjournment of the House and Senate for the Independence Day district work period.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-154, by Mr. Linder.
Resolution provides for consideration of a concurrent resolution for the adjournment of the House and Senate for the Independence Day District Work Period.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 54.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 230 - 194 (Roll no. 242).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/25/1997--Introduced. Makes it in order to consider a concurrent resolution providing for adjournment of the House of Representatives and the Senate for the Independence Day district work period.
